channel.title: Networking on Brian Cunnie's Technical Blog
channel.description: Recent content in Networking on Brian Cunnie's Technical Blog

item.title: Troubleshooting Obscure OpenSSH Failures
item.description: Abstract By using tcpdump to troubleshoot an elusive error, we uncovered a man-in-the-middle (MITM) ssh proxy installed by our information security (InfoSec) team to harden/protect a set of machines which were accessible from the internet. The ssh proxy in question was Palo Alto Network’s (PAN) Layer 7 (i.e. it worked on any port, not solely ssh’s port 22) proxy, and was discovered when we observed a failure to negotiate ciphers during the ssh key exchange.
